fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60491].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When editing tickets within JIRA, screen readers e.g., JAWS are unable to read the page correctly.

h3. Environment
JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-023 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open an existing ticket
Click the Edit button

h3. Expected Results
JAWS should be able to render the entire page including the modal


h3. Actual Results
JAWS is only able to render the page title
 
h3. Notes
Looking at the page code, when clicking the Edit button, there is a JavaScript event firing that applies a hidden tag to the page. It appears this was done to confine focus to the modal window. It appears however that the modal window is hidden from view as well. Removing the ARIA tag, which is hidden, from the page DIV, it should fix the issue.

h3.Workaround
No known work around for this
fields.summary: Screen readers unable to read EDIT modal in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60489].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description
There is no easy way of removing some of the avatars that come pre-shipped with JIRA, so that they are not available to users, although it is possible to add new custom avatars to the list.   In cases where the business nature of certain organisation considers some of the avatars to be inappropriate there is no way to remove those specific avatars from the admin area.

h3. Suggestion
Provide a way to manage what avatars are available to users in admin area.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I'd like to be able to restrict use of some of the default user avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60488].
  {panel}

The only reference for Custom Field contexts in our official documentation is:
{quote}
h3. Adding a new context

Adding a new context allows you to configure a custom field differently for different combinations of issue types and projects.

*To add a new context:*
# Navigate to the Custom Fields page, locate the desired custom field and choose cog icon > Configure.
# Click the Add new context link. The 'Add configuration scheme context' page will be displayed (see below).
#* Under 'Add configuration scheme context', enter a 'Label' and 'Description' for your new context — these are used for administrative purposes only and will not be shown to your end-users.
#* Under 'Choose applicable issue types', select the issue type(s) to which you want this Default Value and Options to apply. You can select Any issue types if you wish.
#* Under 'Choose applicable contexts', select the project(s) to which you want this Default Value and Options to apply. Note that this will apply to only issues with the selected issue type(s) as above.

A custom field can only have one context per JIRA project. So you cannot have multiple contexts for different issue types in the same project.
{quote}
Source: [Configuring a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+a+Custom+Field]

This leaves room for a lot of questions on how contexts work and what happens after a new context is created for an existing field (e.g. when there are existing issues with populated values).

We need to clarify that even if the options from the Default Configuration are the same as the ones used in a context, once a context is created, the old values will be rendered obsolete / read only.

Related bugs and docs:
* [JRA-33026|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33026] - Additional configuration context caused missing value for field with optionid
* [Change Context for an Existing Custom Field Without Losing Old Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Change+Context+for+an+Existing+Custom+Field+Without+Losing+Old+Data]
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Custom Field Contexts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60485].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Some of our customers ask if it is possible to run a single-node instance with a Data Center license (for Bitbucket, JIRA and Confluence). It may not be trivial, but the answer is yes, you simply [install Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html] and skip the steps of adding additional nodes to the cluster.

h4. Request
Please mention this question and the answer in the related FAQs so that this information is publicly accessible, saving time for support and advocates.

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-faqs-666602256.html
fields.summary: Documentation request: Single node data center FAQ

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60483].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Recently the "create linked issue" from the "More" menu under an existing JIRA issue has become available.
The fields displayed on this screen appear to be fixed, and can not get edited using any of the existing screen configurations.
We would like to be able to edit this screen in similar fashion as is possible with the create/edit/view issue screens

*Workaround*
In order for a field to show up, you will need to first add it to the create issue screen relevant to the project.
Then, in the field configuration, the field in question has to be configured to be a "Required" field.
Following these instructions will make the field in question show up in the create linked issue screen.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to change the create linked issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60473].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Adding only content occurring before a specified marker or separator in the email body while the rest of the email body is ignored, is only available for Mail Handlers meant for creating comments in JIRA. For use-cases where there is need to achieve the same for mail handlers meant to create new issues, JIRA doesn't provide an out of the box way to strip content occurring after a designated marker e.g. a regex pattern, excepted for quoted content.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a Issue Creation mail handler that can be configured to strip not just quoted email body, but content occurring after a designated marker or seperator as well.

h3. Notes
The simplest use-case or scenario where this would be relevant is if you would like to always strip out the email signatures from emails.
fields.summary: Add an issue from content before a specified marker or separator in the email body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60471].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Bulk Change permission can be configured in the global permission page and once the respective group has been granted to this permission, the group members will be able to perform a bulk change to all tickets in all projects. This would also allow them to Bulk change tickets for projects they shouldn't be administrating but have permission to edit single tickets.

h3. Suggested Solution
- to use the current Bulk Edit interface (in Issue Navigator) but only display the Bulk Edit option if you have Bulk Edit permission to all projects contained in your search result
- another option would be to enable it or when the project filter is selected & you filtered on projects where you have Bulk edit rights only. This might be better performing as you wouldn't need to check each individual ticket rather the projects in the filter
fields.summary: Ability to have Bulk Change permission on project level

Scenario:
issue is created with work to be done by team
team member A pulls up issue
team member B pulls up issue
team member A clicks 'Assign to me' and starts working
team member B clicks 'Assign to me' and starts working
duplicate work! Possibly bad data in database, embarrassing customer interaction, etc

It would be nice if team member B got a confirmation indicating that the issue had been updated recently and that the issue was currently assigned to A. Did B still want to 'Assign to me' [yes] [no]?

The POST could send the page's current notion of assignee and if that did not match the actual assignee, then the confirmation would be generated instead of simply updating the assignee.
fields.summary: 'Assign to me' link should prompt *if* assignee has changed since page load

h3. Problem Definition
GMAIL has API limits that are causing mail handlers to be throttled. When the mail handler makes several imap request to the same mail box. Gmail will begin to throttle that the request to that account. See Manage your IMAP clients in [Bandwidth Limits|https://support.google.com/a/answer/1071518?hl=en]. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the Default Mail handler when using imap gmail accounts to decrease the amount of request. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Increase the interval delay for the gmail mail handler.
fields.summary: Increase the default setting for the mail handler.

h3. Summary

If a user's username contains Korean characters or spaces (likely other non-ascii characters will fail as well) then a JIRA Core Board will go into an infinite refresh or reload loop.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new 'Project Management' project type.
# Create a user, or edit a user so that their username contains Korean characters (e.g. 안녕하세요 세계)
# As that user attempt to access the JIRA Core Board.

h3. Expected Results

Board loads

h3. Actual Results

Board goes into an infinite refresh loop.

h3.Workaround

No known workaround apart from renaming the user to something with ascii characters

  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When a user sets statistic for the JIRA Pie Chart report to use issue type, JIRA filters parent issue type and sub-task as different segments.

This can lead to skewed results especially if user is trying to get specific information on particular issue types and expects all work done even in the child to be accounted for under it's parent.

h3. Expected Result
JIRA would merger each subtask value directly into it's parent.

h3. Actual Result
JIRA separates sub task from their parents making them calculating them as a segment on it's own.
fields.summary: Allow merging of Sub-Task to Parent in JIRA Pie Chart Report.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60418].
  {panel}

As an administrator I want to get a list of which users are assigned to a project role. It's strange that JIRA doesn't provide this information.
I found this article https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+get+a+list+of+users+assigned+to+project+roles+for+your+project but I want this information to be available on the UI.

 I want to evaluate project-roles and users also in the case of nested groups.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use several REST calls to get this data:

* Getting all Project roles currently associated in the defined Projects by projectkey: [/rest/api/3/project/(projectIdOrKey)/role|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-get]
** eg. https://host.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/SCRUM/role
* Getting all members/users in the Project that are part of the defined Project role (project role id found in previous call): [/rest/api/3/project/(projectIdOrKey)/role/(id)|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-id-get]
** eg. https://host.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/SCRUM/role/10211
* Getting user information that includes active, groups and email: [/rest/api/3/user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-id-get]
** https://host.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?accountId=(acountId)&expand=groups
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to get list of users in a project role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60417].
  {panel}

AS A managing software architect and engineering peer, I WANT the Activity Stream Gadget's global filter for Update Date to store the relative date syntax SO THAT the stream remains current.

The filter allows options like is, is before, is after, and is between.  When I type in a value like is after -1d, the syntax is immediately auto converted to a static date value such as March 31, 2016.  This means that I will have to update the activity stream every day to continue to get comments from just the last day. 

My team documents the work they plan to do each day on the JIRA  each morning and documents progress updates throughout.  The activity stream makes it easier for local and global peers of the development team to monitor planned work, accomplished work, and unplanned work.  Today we work around this bug by streaming the last 5 updates for users without regard to update date.  We only do 5 so as to prevent seeing too many results from previous days.  However, this also forces us to click the 'more' button repeatedly to consume the previous day activity.

This seems to relate to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-1804.
fields.summary: Filter / Display Option improvements for dates to help automate team scrum

h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user creates a sub-task, it is expected to inherit the parent issues components however since JIRA 7.1.X this stopped being so.

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# Craete a test project.
# Create components for this project.
# Add the component field to the view/edit screen.
# Create an issue in the test project.
# Assign components to this issue.
# Create a sub task for the issue using {{More > Create Sub-Task}}

h3. *Expected Result*
JIRA would create the sub-task and it would inherit the components of it's parent issue.

h3. *Actual Result*
JIRA creates the sub-task but clears out the component field.

(i) _Issue has been verified to have started in JIRA 7.1.X_
fields.summary: Sub Task Stopped inheriting Parent components

h3. Summary
((i) It is a trivial bug but would like to report it so that it will be fixed in the future)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60386].
  {panel}

The current Project Categories functionality is way too broad of a feature.  It completely overlooks those using modified agile workflows or non-agile workflow such as in JIRA Core.  Also, it fails to handle the possibility that a single status could be used in 2 different projects at 2 completely different locations in a workflow.  Not to mention that it could possibly be used as 2 separate purposes within the same project in 2 different workflows on 2 different issue types.  The possibility that the same status is used as a ending state (done) and an In Progress state in the same project is very slim, but i've actually seen it before.

For example, I have seen a status called "Verified" which in one workflow was used as the final complete state (Done).  However, on a different issue type in the same project it was used as a middle state in the workflow where "Closed" was used as the Done state.  Now, on the global Status level, which category do you assign to the "Verified" state?

Another example is when a single workflow transitions an issue to multiple different job roles.  Therefore, based on the state of the workflow it may be in person1's queue and they have their own To Do, In Progress, Done statuses, but when it is in Done for person1, then it moves to person2's To Do queue where they also have their own In Progress and Done states.  However, with the global category setting, it turns out that both person1's and person2's statuses all end up being "In Progress" and therefore are all colored yellow.  Have you ever seen a dashboard with this new category system in this use case?  Every single status on the entire dashboard is yellow.  How is that beneficial to the user?

The current implementation also falls short on the UI of the statuses, Please return these status names in the UI to Camel Case because all caps is harder to read.  Human eyes are conditioned to read characters in Camel Case and therefore these words are easier to identify at a single glance.  ALL CAPS ARE TOUGH TO READ BECAUSE EACH CHARACTER IS THE SAME HEIGHT AND THEREFORE THE BRAIN NEEDS TO READ EACH CHARACTER SEPARATELY IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE WORDS.  This is just something that will allow users to be able to quickly identify the status by name since the vast majority, if not all, statuses will be in a yellow state.

With the Categories, you have gone backwards in the ability to quickly identify a status and it's meaning.

On other issues it has been mentioned that the new categories was put in place in order to assist with the new Project Release board which shows the current fix version and a "pretty" blue, yellow, green bar to show the progress of that version.  Since this seems to be the only reason to implement project categories, it just doesn't make sense to do so on the global level.  For the same reasons as above, the project categories could be incorrectly colored for one project, but be correct for another.  Therefore, the Release board is only useful for 1 of those 2 projects.  Therefore, if you want to keep the Release board around, you should shift the category assignments to statuses down to at least the project level if not the project/issue type level.

In summary, the status categories need to be removed or altered to better suit ALL possible uses of JIRA.  Atlassian is making a big push with JIRA Core, JIRA Software, and JIRA Service Desk to make JIRA appealing to all different types of uses, but this functionality goes against that drive and actually hinders it.  Please make a change.
fields.summary: Bring back Status Icons and shift Categories to the project administration/reporting level

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , the way Administration searching works , it will go through a tree list . The list started from Applications tabs and end with System tab . When you click JIRA Administration , it will list down Applications , Project , Issues , Add Ons , User Management and System . So , when you typed Support , JIRA will detect the first five matched the word .

h3. Suggested Solution

# Make the search result list more results (maybe 10 instead of 5), rolling list of search results.
# Make it possible to search for category and/or menu-items.
# Make the list of matched menu-items come before the matching categories.
# Renaming of categories and/or menu items so that this won´t conflict.

Currently the most of the user experienced with this [JSW-12792|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-12792] bug after they upgraded to Jira 7 and there are no any documentation that stated that Jira Agile add-on in previous version (eg:6.4.x) must be upgraded before upgrade to Jira 7. h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA has a significant number of Custom Fields, over 100, it becomes difficult to find/reuse a custom field.  This can causes duplicate Custom Fields to be created by different JIRA admin since an exhaustive search is close to impossible.

h3. Suggested Solution
A simple solution would be to allow the name and type column to be selected and then the contents columns will be put in alphabetical order.

Another solution would be to have a multiple selection field where you could select one or a couple of custom fileld types at a time.
 
h3. Workaround 
None

h4. *Issue Summary*

When a user clones an issue, it is expected that all information related to time tracking are not cloned as stated in [our documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA061/Cloning+an+Issue].
{code}
* Time tracking

h3. Summary

h3. Problem Definition
Configure JIRA (Core) notification schema to send different mail template for different users. For example to watchers and reporter send email with less data/info (data, event, title...) and to the assignee (and all others), send a full mail with more issue data (data, event, title, due date, description, last comment...)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60348].
  {panel}

In the [JIRA applications and project types overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/JIRA+applications+and+project+types+overview] documentation it is not clearly stated that users with JIRA Software license already have access to all the JIRA Core functionalities and that they don't need another license for this.

The only place where this information is clearly state is the [below post on the atlassian answers website|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/30953879/whats-the-difference-between-jira-software-and-jira]:
{quote}
This is more on licensing. Rather than any product changes/functionality changes
 
JIRA Software : JIRA + JIRA Agile
JIRA CORE : JIRA only without JIRA Agile
JIRA Service Desk: JIRA Service Desk (no changes)
 
Licensing: Previously, if you have 500-user JIRA license, you will need 500 JIRA Agile license as well. Now, no.

Example, in your company, you have 100 user using JIRA and only 30 of them using JIRA+JIRA Agile. You can opt to have 70 user license JIRA Core with 30-user license JIRA Software. Thats why JIRA Core license still exist.

You can still install JIRA Software, and apply only JIRA core license in the license page. And enjoy JIRA functionality without JIRA Agile. And if suddenly you decides that you need Agile capability. Just add the JIRA Software license so you can enjoy Agile functionality. No problem! (smile)
{quote}
fields.summary: It is not clearly stated in the documentation that JIRA Software already includes JIRA Core

h3. Problem Definition

When creating a new project using a shared configuration, users and roles are not shared between projects. This way, when creating a new project where the same users will have the same roles, they have to be added manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add the option to share the users and roles between projects or to copy them over to the new project when creating it.

h3. Workaround

The only workaround would be to add the users to their roles manually.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60326].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA has a new REST API call for user properties. However, the documentation is not clear on the specifics of this call as explained by the dev in the below 2 comments to linked issues:
 # JRACLOUD-45502:
{quote}The user properties that can be set via the user profile page and the user properties exposed in the JIRA REST API are actually two completely different storage mechanisms, which explains why user properties set from EditUserProperties.jspa are not returned when you call the REST API.

The new user properties in the REST API are intended to be used by remote integrations and add-ons to store per-user data and settings. This helps add-ons provide a customized experience for each JIRA user while keeping all the data in the JIRA Cloud instance's database. These properties are generally intended to be used by add-ons. We do not plan to build a UI to create and set properties – you are more than welcome to use them, but to retrieve user properties using a GET request on /rest/api/2/user/properties, they must be set with a PUT to /rest/api/2/user/properties/\{propertyKey}.

We absolutely recognize the confusion that having two different sets of user properties can cause, and we intend to rectify this in the future.
{quote}
 # JRACLOUD-59760:
{quote}There is a [free add-on for JIRA Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.connect.entity-property-tool.prod/cloud/overview] that provides the ability to edit user entity properties, which are [accessible via the user entity properties REST API discussed on this issue|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user/properties]. 

We know that one of the most common use cases for user properties is workflow automation. For that reason, add-ons like the new [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions add-on for JIRA Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions/cloud/overview] have also implemented their own user interfaces for setting and managing user properties.

The reason we are not planning to expose a REST API for the legacy user preferences/properties that are currently not accessible via REST is that we are making a number of changes to how users are stored in Atlassian Cloud as we roll out [Atlassian accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/purchasing/introducing-atlassian-account-738362254.html]. Unfortunately, migrating legacy user preferences to the new user entity properties available via REST is not straightforward.
{quote}
  

Therefore, users would be attempting to access properties of users created via UI using REST API and also will expect to access properties created via REST API from the UI. However, this is an intended behavior as explained in the above tickets.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please update the doc to clarify the rest call as explained by the dev
fields.summary: Update Rest API documentation to clarify about /rest/api/2/user/properties/{propertyKey}

h3. Summary

When editing an issue through the filter issue gadget it throws the error:

{code}Error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.JiraMultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null){code}

!60321.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new filter that will return any valid issue.
# Create a new dashboard
# Add a filter issue gadget and select the filter created in the first step.
# Right side of any issue, select the three dots button and Edit.
# In the new edit window, select Update.

h3. Expected Results

The issue would be updated and the screen return to the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is update but the UI throws an error.

h3. Workaround

Manually back to the dashboard or open the issue and edit there.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60318].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

After an issue is edited, some users may be notified for this change, which will include the fields that were edited, their previous and new values.

When editing an issue with the ‘Edit’ button (not inline), if both the ‘Description’ and the ‘Assignee’ fields are edited, only the ‘Assignee’ field is included in the notification email.

This was tested with several combination of fields and it seems that the ‘Description’ is always part of the notification, except when the ‘Assignee’ field is also edited. If several other fields are included along with ‘Assignee’ and ‘Description’, only the ‘Description’ is not part of the notification.

This is an example when changing ‘Labels’, 'Summary' and ‘Description’, but not ‘Assignee’:
!no_assignee.png|thumbnail!

If we change the same fields and ‘Assignee’ as well, the ‘Description’ is not included. In the change below, the ‘Description’ was edited in the same operation, but not included in the notification:
!assignee_included.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and have a user notified for ‘Issue Updated’
# Edit an issue and change its ‘Description’
# Edit it again, changing its ‘Description’ and its ‘Assignee’

h3. Expected Results
Both notifications include the ‘Description’ field being changed.

h3. Actual Results
Only when we don’t include ‘Assignee’ in the change does it include the ‘Description’.

h3.Workaround
Change the ‘Assignee’ in a separate operation.
fields.summary: Editing both Assignee and Description prevents Description from being included in notification

From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38048349/answers/38049721

Suggestion: Add a way to set the default view to "List" instead of "Details" for a specific filter.

This would be useful when sharing a filter with others - sometimes I set up a filter to have specific columns with useful information, but when sharing the filter with others the view seems to default to "Details" so other users aren't aware of the customized columns in List view. 

It would be nice to be able to set a default view for the filter, so when other users view the filter they see the customized view.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60304].
  {panel}

In our workflow we have a transition called 'Reject', that has a transition-screen named 'only comments'. This screen has no fields, so in JIRA the result is a transition with a screen that only holds the comment field. The 'Reject' transition has a validator that requires a comment filled in.

When a bulk transition of 'Reject' is used, JIRA does not see that a screen is attached (I guess it can't see the difference between an empty screen and no screen at all).

Result is that we can not give any comments and therefor the validation failed. So no bulk transitions is possible for this transition:

 !image-2016-03-23-11-48-12-447.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support adding a comment during bulk transitions when no fields are on the transition screen

h3. Problem Definition

The Wiki Markup in JIRA has two "Preformatted" options. One is under the "Style" dropdown and is only available for a single line text:

!style.png|thumbnail!

While the other is under the "+" dropdown and can be used for a long text with multiple lines:

!more.png|thumbnail!

This can cause some confusion for users since they share the same name and the difference between them is not clear.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the name of one of them or specify that all styles under "Style" are available only for single-line texts.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60293].
  {panel}

*Current behaviour*
*Trigger*: Addition of a 'Group custom field value > your-group-picker-custom-field' to Browse Projects permission in a permission scheme.
*Causes*: All project names of projects using that permission scheme to become viewable by all users.
*Already Verified by Atlassian*: [JST-189143|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-189143]

*Expected behaviour*
The trigger above would make each project name using that permission scheme to be viewable just by members of groups which names are selectable values in the appropriate context(s) for that project(s).

*Research on old issues*
*Similar issue*: JRA-10940 (Closed because of a long inactivity period, but not resolved)
*Caused by?*: JRA-14670
*Related to?*: JRA-26659, JRA-23732, JRA-30209, JRA-30783, JRA-43008, JRA-37242
*Bugs that may be fixed*: JRA-28278, JRA-28523, JRA-19577
*Perceived as a bug*: JRA-30784

*Documentation*
The current behaviour should be documented.
Besides other documentation pages, it would be good to add the following phrase under the section [Managing Issues via Group Ownership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/how-do-i-assign-issues-to-multiple-users-207489749.html#HowdoIassignissuestomultipleusers-ManagingIssuesviaGroupOwnership] 
_Note that granting with Browse Projects permission to a 'Group custom field value' will make all project names using that permission scheme to be viewable by all users._
fields.summary: Improve implementation of 'Group custom field value' on permission schemes
